line_1: Your melting Lines, make conscious Passion vent
line_2: More solemn Griefs, than common Nature meant.

line_1: See fond IERNE gives her sorrows vent,
line_2: See even the northern ORCADES lament!

line_1: In what expressions give the tidings vent,
line_2: HOW shall my pen make known the sad event,

line_1: Convulsive rage, and struggling heave for vent;
line_2: When lab'ring passions, in his bosom pent,

line_1: Struck on his mind, and thus he gave it vent: —
line_2: 'T was then, a spark of — say not discontent —

line_1: Forc'd his unwilling tongue to give them vent.
line_2: At length the thoughts within his bosom pent,
Could swerve so quickly from its first intent;

line_1: My burden'd Thoughts, which labour for a Vent,
line_2: Urge me t'explain in Verse, what by each Face is meant.

line_1: Convulse the Mountain, lab'ring for a Vent;
line_2: For, as the Flames, in Aetna closely pent,

line_1: She flew — she gave her sorrows vent —
line_2: Her mournful voice, her moving plaint,

line_1: The dense smoke, issuing from its narrow vent,
line_2: Is to the air in curly volumes sent,

line_1: Ere yet the lips have giv'n the secret vent,
line_2: Who read'st mankind, and seest the heart's intent,

line_1: Now stopping short to give his transports vent;
line_2: Now skipping on, and singing as he went,

line_1: And all the Furies issued at the Vent.
line_2: Full o'er their Heads the swelling Bag he rent,

line_1: The more 'twill struggle for a vent:
line_2: He wisely thinks the more 'tis pent,

line_1: And there alone have given my sorrows vent.
line_2: All mournfully my slow step have I bent,

line_1: For ten good Thoughts, amongst the Crowd they vent,
